533724-d-09-17-06-DMIR.Narrative: YTH608-18 WAS PULLING CARS FROM TWO HARBORS DOCK ACCOUNT PROBLEMS AT THE DOCK NOT ALLOWING CARS TO BE DUMPED.  THREE CARS HAD BEEN DUMPED AND TWO CARS WERE LEFT LOADED.   WHEN THE DOCK ASKED TO HAVE THE TRACK PULLED, THEY DIDN'T CLOSE THE DOOR ON CAR DMIR 52720 CAUSING THE DOOR TO HANG DOWN AND FOULTHE TRACK.  WHEN THE TRAIN BACKED UP THE DOORS HIT 4 SWITCHES WHICH CAUSED 5 CARS TO DERAIL- DMIR 52720, DMIR 52020, DMIR 51129, AND DMIR 51318.  THERE IS SUPPOSE TO BE A SAFETY DEVICE AT THE DOCK TOCATCH THE CARS WITH OPEN DOORS WHICH WOULD ALLOW THE DOCK GROUP TO STOP THE TRAIN MOVEMENT BEFORE ANYTHING DERAILED THIS SAFETY DEVICE DIDN'T WORK AND THE CAR WASN'T CAUGHT.  THE CREW FAILED TO MAKESURE THAT ALL THE DOORS WERE CLOSED PRIOR TO PULLING THE CARS..

INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THE CAUSE WAS DETERMINEDTO BE BUFF FORCES FROM 14 LOADED CARS ON A 2 DEGREE GRADE RUNNING ON THE EMPTY CARS-DUE TO THE TRAIN MAKE-UP.  WHILE IT WAS FOUND THAT THE CAUSE OF THIS DERAILMENT WAS HUMAN FAILURE, NO EMPLOYEE HASBEEN HELD RESPONSIBLE DUE TO THE FACT THAT NO INSTRUCTIONS WERE PROVIDED, AT THE TIME, TO PREVENT THIS FROM HAPPENING.  THE PROCEDURES HAVE SINCE BEEN PUT IN PLACE.

198397-d-09-28-06-SOO.Primary Accident Cause: Other train operation/human factors (Provide detailed description in narrative)

198397-d-09-28-06-SOO.Narrative: TRAIN 293-28 MET TRAIN 498-27 AT LORETTO. CONDUCTOR FROM 498 WAS MAKING A ROLL-BY INSPECTION OF 293,WHEN HE NOTICED SPARKS COMING OFF A WHEEL ON 293'S TRAIN WHICH WAS PROCEEDING WESTBOUND ON THE MAINTRACK.  ENGINEER ON TRAIN 293 TOOK A FIRST SERVICE BRAKE REDUCTION TO STOP TRAIN AND INSPECT, BUT THE AIR DUMPED SHORTLY THEREAFTER. CONDUCTOR  INSPECTED TRAIN AND FOUND 6 CARS DERAILED NEAR THE WESTSIDING SWITCH - LORETTO. TRAIN 498 WAS NOT INVOLVED AND DID  NOT SUSTAIN ANY DAMAGE FROM THE DERAILMENT. *UPDATE* ALTHOUGH THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF THE FAILED BEARING ON THE NOKL 728211, THE PRIMARY CAUSE IS DUE TO THE RAILROAD NOT FORWARDING THE INFORMATION THAT THIS CAR HAD BEEN IDENTIFIED WITH A DEFECTIVE BEARING. TRAIN 295-20, HANDLING THE NOKL 728211, WAS HEADING WEST INTO HUMBOLDT YARD WHEN THE TRAIN WAS VISUALLY OBSERVED WITH A HOT BEARING. THE 295-20 TRAIN CREW SET OFF THENOKL 728211 AT HUMBOLDT YARD  & NOTIFIED THE DISPATCHER & THE HUMBOLDT YARDMASTER. THE BAD ORDER STATUS FOR THE NOKL 728211 WAS NOT COMMUNICATED TO LOCAL MECHANICAL FORCES. THE CONDUCTOR ON 295 FAILED TO FAX IN FORM 1225 UPON ARRIVAL AT GLENWOOD MN.  AS A RESULT TRAIN 293-28 LIFTED NOKL 728211 FROMHUMBOLDT YARD WITHOUT HAVING COMPLETED THE NECESSARY REPAIRS & THE BEARING FAILED AT LORETTO, MN.

THEY PULLED AHEAD AFTER LEAVING CARS IN 1 TRACK AND WERE STOPPING WHEN SWITCH FOREMAN NOTICED DUST AND INSTRUCTED THE ENGINEER TO STOP.  TWO LOCOMOTIVES AND FIVE CARS WERE DERAILED.  TWO LOCOMOTIVES HAD NON-ALIGNING DRAWBARS.  THE DRAWBARS SLEWED BETWEEN THE LOCOMOTIVES CAUSING THE REAR TRUCK OF RLCX 1700 TO DERAIL.  THE CREW WAS NOT DRUG/ALCOHOL TESTED.  THERE WERE NO INJURIES.   REVIEWED RULE AND TRAIN HANDLING PROCEDURES FOR NON-ALIGNMENT DRAWBARS AND MADE SIGNIFICANT CHANGES.  INCLUDED WOULD BE CREW NOTIFICATION, LIMIT OF ONE PER TRAIN, TRAINING OF TRAIN CREWS, TONNAGE RESTRICTIONS, AND REQUIRING TEMPORARY BLOCKS.  NO INDIVIDUAL EMPLOYEE WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS INCIDENT, THEREFORE FORMS 78 AND 81 COULD NOT BE COMPLETED.

LOCAL TEMPERATURE WAS APPROXIMATELY 70 DEGREES FARHRENHEIT.  METHOD OF OPERATION FOR THE BEECH MOUNTAIN INTERCHANGE TRACK IS UNCONTROLLED YARD LIMITS.  LOCATION OF THE INCIDENT WAS APPROXIMATELY BEEM MILEPOST 2.8.  THE EAST RAIL BROKE UNDER 11TH CAR FROM THE LOCOMOTIVE IN HANGING ROCK CURVE.  THREE ADDITIONAL CARS CROSSED THE POINT OF FRACTURE, RESULTING IN A TOTAL OF NINE AXLES DERAILING.  CONTRIBUTING CAUSE FOR THE BROKEN RAIL WAS UNFINISHED CONTRACTOR WORK ON HANGING ROCKCURVE, WHICH INCLUDED A NUMBER OF IMPROPERLY SPIKED RAILROAD TIES.  NO CASUALTIES OCCURRED AS A RESULT OF THIS INCIDENT.

LOCAL TEMPERATURE WAS APPROXIMATELY 45 DEGREES FARHRENHEIT WITH VISIBILITY RESTRICTED BY FOG.METHOD OF OPERATION FOR THE BEECH MOUNTAIN INTERCHANGE TRACK IS UNCONTROLLED YARD LIMITS.  LOCATIONOF THE INCIDENT WAS APPROXIMATELY BEEM MILEPOST 0.6.THE CIRCUMSTANCES LEADING UP TO THE INCIDENT BEGAN WITH A MAINTENANCE OF WAY CONTRACTOR ESTABLISHING ROADWAY WORKER PROTECTION ON THE BEECH MOUNTAININTERCHANGE TRACK THROUGH INACCESSIBLE TRACK.  PORTABLE DERAILS EQUIP-PED WITH REFLECTIVE TARGETS WERE PLACED ON THE TWO TRACKS LEADING TO THE WORK ZONE PREVENTING ACCESS-ONE ON THE INTERCHANGE TRACKAND A SECOND ON THE RUNAROUND SIDING.  MAINTNANCE OF WAY EQUIPMENT WAS TIED DOWN WITHIN THESE WORKING LIMITS, INCLUDING A TAMPER ON THE INTERCHANGE TRACK.  ON SEPTEMBER 17TH, AN APPALACHIAN AND OHIORAILROAD CREW BEGAN PLACING EMPTY COAL HOPPERS ON THE INTERCHANGE TRACK, A MOVEMENT THAT REQUIRES THE LOCOMOTIVES TO SHOVE EMPTY HOPPERS APPROXIMATELY 60 CARS SHOUTHWARD FROM THE JUNCTION POINT.  THEA AND O CONDUCTOR PROTECTED HIS TRAIN'S SHOVING MOVEMENT FOR APPROXIMATELY THE FIRST 30 CAR LENGTHS,BUT FAILED TO PROTECT THE SHOVE BEYOND THAT POINT, WHICH RESULTED IN THE LEADING COAL HOPPER STRIKI
